intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon var. onilahensis, commonly known as the Onilahen tarrietia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a distinctive red or pink coloration on the underside. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
